basics.name: Caleb Atwood
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: While my professional projects to date have primarily consisted of scaled backend services, database design, and web frontends for Xbox Live, my personal projects walk the spectrum... mobile react apps, ecommerce sites, computer vision algorithms, 3D reconstruction applications, game development, drone construction, home-security hardware design, simulation, several musical projects, and a startup to boot.

work.summary: Service platform engineer on Xbox Live, the collection of services that comprise Xbox's social graph, content distribution, and multiplayer. On multiple occasions, I worked across org with other teams to bring Xbox Live configuration to their products.
highlights: Primary dev on Xbox Developer Portal
Patented design for Xbox Devkit Conversion
Worked as consulting member to the Windows Dev Center to bring games to Windows.
Worked directly with Minecraft to enable User Generated Content for the title.
Lead a small team in designing Game Modes, a realtime configuration service for tournaments on Xbox.

work.summary: Mixing the Microsoft Kinect, cutting edge 3D computer vision algorithms, and a completely fresh 3D in-browser experience, myFit seeks to change the way you shop for clothing. My job entailed system architecture design, task lead, back-end and front-end developing, 2D and 3D computer vision, and product design.
highlights: Won the Plug and Play Tech Accelerator in Sunnyvale, CA.
Project lead of a team of 3 engineers

awards.title: Patent filed for Securely Enabling Devkits
awards.summary: Co-inventor on a new method for securely converting retail hardware devices into development kits.

awards.title: Patent filed for Cloud-Based 3D Body Reconstruction
awards.summary: Co-inventor on a new method for uploading and processing 3 dimensional point clouds of the human body with the purpose of generating a mesh.

publications.name: Festival
publications.summary: A react-native + redux ios application built with firebase for localized conversations and realtime sharing at music festivals

publications.name: Minecraft Go
publications.summary: An augmented realty mobile app based on Pokemon Go, with real terrain and procedurally generated structures that resemble those from the game Minecraft. Built with Unity, Google Places, and MapZen.
